title: Earth from Space: Branco River, Brazil
Insects on the space menu
summary: Long before humans reached orbit, insects had already shown they could handle the hurdles of spaceflight. Light, highly adaptable and nutritionally rich, these resilient animals present an attractive option for European researchers studying reliable food sources for long-duration missions.

title: Andy Stofan, Former NASA Lewis Center Director and Space Station AA Passes Away
summary: Andy Stofan, who was Director of Lewis (now Glenn) Research Center and then headed the space station program at NASA headquarters in the mid-1980s, passed away on October 26, 2025. […]

title: In-Q-Tel invests in Vast
summary:
An investment by a venture fund affiliated with the U.S. national security community in commercial space station developer Vast is not necessarily a sign of military interest in human spaceflight.
The post In-Q-Tel invests in Vast appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Live coverage: Atlas 5 makes another try to launch ViaSat-3 F2 communications satellite
summary: United Launch Alliance is counting down to a second launch attempt for an Atlas 5 rocket carrying the ViaSat-3 F2 satellite. Liftoff from pad 41 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is scheduled for 10:16 p.m. EST (0316 UTC) at the opening of a 44-minute launch window.

title: FCC commissioner warns U.S. influence on satellite spectrum debates could wane
summary:
A member of the Federal Communications Commission warned that declining American influence could make it harder to secure support for key satellite industry priorities at international conferences.
The post FCC commissioner warns U.S. influence on satellite spectrum debates could wane appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: BlackSky hit by U.S. budget cuts, but international demand lifts outlook
summary:
Despite the domestic headwinds, BlackSky is seeing a sharp uptick in overseas business.
The post BlackSky hit by U.S. budget cuts, but international demand lifts outlook appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Sceye wins NASA award for stratospheric Earth observations
summary:
A company developing stratospheric platforms for telecommunications and related applications has won a NASA award to use that platform for environmental monitoring.
The post Sceye wins NASA award for stratospheric Earth observations appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 28 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg SFB
summary: Following deployment, SpaceX will have launched a total of 2,600 Starlink V2 Mini satellites so far this year. Liftoff of the Starlink 11-14 mission from pad 4E at Vandenberg Space Force Base is scheduled for 1:13 p.m. PST (4:13 p.m. EST / 2113 UTC).

title: After Russian spaceport firm fails to pay bills, electric company turns the lights off
summary: "If you increase the cost, you’ll get everything in two years. If not, I’m sorry.”
